## 


```{r}
df1 <- data.frame(
  Au = c(0, 1),
  Prior = c(0.3, 0.7),
  Posterior = c(1, 0)
)

```

```{r}
# Assuming your data frame is named df
df_long <- tidyr::pivot_longer(df1, cols = c("Prior", "Posterior"), names_to = "Type", values_to = "Value")

ggplot(df_long, aes(x = factor(Type), y = Value, fill = Au)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge") +
  labs(x = "Au", y = "Probability", title = "Prior and Posterior by Au") +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Create the data in long format
df_long <- data.frame(
  Type = rep(c("Prior", "Posterior"), each = 2),
  Au = factor(rep(c(0, 1), times = 2)),
  Value = c(0.3, 0.7, 1, 0)
)

df_long$Type <- factor(df_long$Type, levels = c("Prior", "Posterior"))

# Plot
ggplot(df_long, aes(x = Type, y = Value, fill = Au)) +
  geom_col(position = "dodge", width = 0.7) +
  scale_fill_discrete(labels = c("Au=0", "Au=1")) +
  #scale_fill_manual(
    #values = c("#2b5c82", "#f5b041"),
    #name = "Au",
    #labels = c("Au=0", "Au=1")
  #) +
  labs(
    title = "Total variation distance for Au",
    x = NULL,
    y = NULL
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
  )


```
